SCM Framework

CausalDynamics.AbstractSCM — Type
AbstractSCM

Abstract type for Structural Causal Models.

source
CausalDynamics.GraphSCM — Type
GraphSCM

A Structural Causal Model represented as a graph and structural equations.

Fields

  • graph: Directed acyclic graph
  • equations: Dictionary mapping nodes to functions
  • exogenous: Set of exogenous nodes
source
CausalDynamics.SymbolicSCM — Type
SymbolicSCM

A Structural Causal Model with symbolic equations (using ModelingToolkit.jl).

Fields

  • graph: Directed acyclic graph
  • system: ModelingToolkit system
  • exogenous: Set of exogenous variable names
source
CausalDynamics.create_symbolic_scm — Function
create_symbolic_scm(graph, equations_dict)

Create a symbolic SCM from a graph and dictionary of equations.

Arguments

  • graph: Directed acyclic graph
  • equations_dict: Dictionary mapping node names to symbolic equations

Returns

  • SymbolicSCM object

Examples

using CausalDynamics, Graphs, ModelingToolkit, Symbolics

@variables x, y, z, u_x, u_y
@parameters α, β

g = DiGraph(3)
add_edge!(g, 1, 2)  # X → Y
add_edge!(g, 3, 1)  # Z → X

equations = Dict(
    :x => α * z + u_x,
    :y => β * x + u_y,
    :z => u_x  # Exogenous
)

scm = create_symbolic_scm(g, equations)
source
CausalDynamics.DoIntervention — Type
DoIntervention

Represents a do(·) intervention.

Fields

  • variable: Variable to intervene on
  • value: Value to set
source
CausalDynamics.apply_intervention — Function
apply_intervention(scm, intervention)

Apply a do(·) intervention to an SCM.

Arguments

  • scm: Structural Causal Model
  • intervention: DoIntervention object

Returns

  • Modified SCM with intervention applied

Examples

using CausalDynamics

intervention = DoIntervention(:x, 1.0)
scm_intervened = apply_intervention(scm, intervention)
source
CausalDynamics.do_intervention — Function
do_intervention(variable, value)

Convenience function to create a DoIntervention.

Examples

intervention = do_intervention(:x, 1.0)
source
CausalDynamics.counterfactual_graph — Function
counterfactual_graph(scm, intervention)

Generate a counterfactual graph for a given intervention.

Arguments

  • scm: Structural Causal Model
  • intervention: Intervention to apply

Returns

  • Counterfactual SCM

Note

Counterfactuals require shared exogenous noise. This function generates the graph structure for counterfactual reasoning.

source
